TopicTitle: How does Starfield compare to KSP2 (ship & base building, environment, IVA, HUD)?

Articles.Content:
57 minutes ago, fragtzack said:

This forum thread seems out of place in a forum category devoted to Kerbal Space Program 2. 

Starfield is not even worth comparing to KSP(1 and 2) , as the intended purposes of the games listed are vey far apart. 

 

Move this thread to "The Lounge" please!

I agree - comparisons don't belong on a subforum that is meant to be dedicated to KSP 2.
Interesting game you never heard of.
The second half of the video perfectly sums it up. And why too high ambitions of a studio without big publisher behind it rarely work out.
Dual univers seems to be Star citizen but without Chris Roberts and his ability to Hoover up money. Makes you wonder what they could have done with his income.

On 7/11/2022 at 12:01 PM, Bej Kerman said:

I agree - comparisons don't belong on a subforum that is meant to be dedicated to KSP 2.

While I agree in general, generaly comparisons are a valid way of examining a game, it’ but its also somewhat counterproductive to talk about differences, when at base both games are completely different in what they want to do.

 

Stafrield wants to be a “single player MMO” that wants you to solve its puzzle/mystery and build some kind of deport network while you do, KSP wants you to build a space spanning civilization. Both want you to see what’s out there, but both have diferent focuses and ways to get it done.

7 minutes ago, [email protected] said:

wants to be a “single player MMO”

Also called "RPGs"

Starfiel is a completely different genre, it has as much in common with KSP as a Space themed monopoly would have.

Oh I know, I’m talking more along the like of scale and intention, most single player RPGs tend to be comparatively small, and the world maps are not easily convertible into mmos, while many of Bethesdas world map scales are big enough to drop a couple of dozen if not hundreds of  people on the map at the same time, it’s largely the game engine that restricts population.

Basically I meant more along the line of MMO scale.
Since the discussion here has become about other games, the thread has been moved out of the KSP2 subforum.
So... anyone dares to be hyped again, this time for Starfield?
